title: Old Broadway, New Voices
sub_head: Seven plays by Black authors are hitting the New York stage this fall but not Katori Hall’s ‘The Hot Wing King,’ which won this year’s Pulitzer Prize. But it’s not too late to change that.
body: Fifteen months after Covid-19 shut America’s theaters, Broadway is starting to reopen, albeit tentatively. “Springsteen on Broadway,” Bruce Springsteen’s hugely successful 2017 one-man concert show, returned to the St. James Theater on Saturday. No masks, no social distancing, but everyone in the full 1,710-seat house supplied proof of vaccination as a condition of admission.
